Multilevel Analysis of Individual Heterogeneity and Discriminatory Accuracy

MAIHDA-package.Rd

The MAIHDA package provides tools for conducting Multilevel Analysis of Individual Heterogeneity and Discriminatory Accuracy. This approach is useful for examining intersectional inequalities in health and other outcomes.

Main Functions

  • make_strata: Create intersectional strata from multiple variables

  • fit_maihda: Fit multilevel models using lme4 or brms

  • summary_maihda: Summarize models with variance partition and stratum estimates

  • predict_maihda: Make predictions at individual or stratum level

  • plot_maihda: Visualize results with various plot types

  • compare_maihda: Compare models with bootstrap confidence intervals

Author

MAIHDA Package Authors

References

Evans, C. R., Williams, D. R., Onnela, J. P., & Subramanian, S. V. (2018). A multilevel approach to modeling health inequalities at the intersection of multiple social identities. Social Science & Medicine, 203, 64-73.

Merlo, J. (2018). Multilevel analysis of individual heterogeneity and discriminatory accuracy (MAIHDA) within an intersectional framework. Social Science & Medicine, 203, 74-80.
